SQL> SELECT o.last, o.first, COUNT(co.crime_id) AS "CRIMES REPORTED"
  2  FROM officers o JOIN crime_officers co
  3  ON o.officer_id = co.officer_id
  4  HAVING COUNT(co.crime_id) > (SELECT AVG(COUNT(co.officer_id))
  5                               FROM officers o JOIN crime_officers co
  6                               ON o.officer_id = co.officer_id
  7                               GROUP BY o.officer_id)
  8  GROUP BY o.last, o.first;

LAST            FIRST      CRIMES REPORTED SQL> SELECT c.last, c.first, COUNT(c.criminal_id) AS "NUMBER OF CRIMES"
  2  FROM criminals c JOIN crimes cr
  3  ON c.criminal_id = cr.criminal_id
  4  WHERE c.v_status = 'N'
  5  HAVING COUNT(c.criminal_id) < (SELECT AVG(COUNT(c.criminal_id))
  6                                 FROM criminals c JOIN crimes cr
  7                                 ON c.criminal_id = cr.criminal_id
  8                                 GROUP BY c.criminal_id)
  9  GROUP BY c.last, c.first;

LAST            FIRST      NUMBER OF CRIMES 9 rows selected.

SQL> SELECT a.appeal_id, a.crime_id, a.filing_date, a.hearing_date, a.status
  2  FROM appeals a
  3  WHERE (a.hearing_date - a.filing_date) < (SELECT AVG(a.hearing_date - a.filing_date)
  4                                            FROM appeals a);

                                         

SQL> SELECT po.last, po.first, COUNT(s.criminal_id) AS "CRIMINALS ASSIGNED"
  2  FROM prob_officers po JOIN sentences s
  3  ON po.prob_id = s.prob_id
  4  HAVING COUNT(s.criminal_id) < (SELECT AVG(COUNT(s.criminal_id))
  5                                 FROM prob_officers po JOIN sentences s
  6                                 ON po.prob_id = s.prob_id
  7                                 GROUP BY po.last, po.first)
  8  GROUP BY po.last, po.first;

SQL> SELECT cc.crime_code, COUNT(a.appeal_id)
  2  FROM crime_charges cc JOIN appeals a
  3  ON cc.crime_id = a.crime_id
  4  HAVING COUNT(a.appeal_id) >= (SELECT MAX(COUNT(a.appeal_id))
  5                                FROM appeals a JOIN crime_charges cc
  6                                ON a.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  7                                GROUP BY a.appeal_id)
  8  GROUP BY cc.crime_code;

CRIME_CODE COUNT(A.APPEAL_ID) SQL> SELECT cc.charge_id, cc.crime_id, cc.crime_code, cc.charge_status, cc.fine_amount, cc.court_fee, cc.amount_paid, cc.pay_due_date
  2  FROM crime_charges cc
  3  WHERE cc.fine_amount > (SELECT AVG(cc.fine_amount)
  4                          FROM crime_charges cc)
  5  AND cc.amount_paid < (SELECT AVG(cc.amount_paid)
  6                        FROM crime_charges cc);

 CHARGE_ID   CRIME_ID CRIME_CODE CH FINE_AMOUNT  COURT_FEE AMOUNT_PAID PAY_DUE_D                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

SQL> SELECT c.last, c.first
  2  FROM criminals c JOIN crimes cr
  3  ON c.criminal_id = cr.criminal_id
  4  JOIN crime_charges cc
  5  ON cr.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  6  WHERE cc.crime_code =ANY (SELECT cc.crime_code
  7                            FROM crime_charges cc
  8                            WHERE cc.crime_id = 10089)
  9  GROUP BY c.last, c.first;

SQL> SELECT c.last, c.first
  2  FROM criminals c
  3  WHERE EXISTS (SELECT s.prob_id
  4                FROM sentences s
  5                WHERE c.criminal_id = s.criminal_id);

SQL> SELECT o.last, o.first, COUNT(co.crime_id) AS "BOOKED CRIMES"
  2  FROM officers o JOIN crime_officers co
  3  ON o.officer_id = co.officer_id
  4  HAVING COUNT(co.crime_id) = (SELECT MAX(COUNT(co.crime_id))
  5                               FROM crime_officers co JOIN officers o
  6                               ON co.officer_id = o.officer_id
  7                               GROUP BY o.last, o.first)
  8  GROUP BY o.last, o.first;

                                         

SQL> MERGE INTO criminals a
  2  USING criminals_dw b
  3  ON (a.criminal_id = b.criminal_id)
  4  WHEN MATCHED THEN
  5  UPDATE SET a.street = b.street, a.city = b.city, a.state = b.state, a.zip = b.zip, a.phone = b.phone, a.v_status = b.v_status, a.p_status = b.p_status
  6  WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN
  7  INSERT (criminal_id, last, first, street, city, state, zip, phone, v_status, p_status)
  8  VALUES (b.criminal_id, b.last, b.first, b.street, b.city, b.state, b.zip, b.phone, b.v_status, b.p_status);

6 rows merged.

SQL> spool off
